intro: Piptocarpha sprucei, commonly known as the Sierra dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Piptocarpha sprucei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with limited rainfall.
